metadata.title: CVE-2023-32252 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's ksmbd, a high-performance in-kernelSMB server. The specific flaw exists within the handling of SMB2_LOGOFFcommands. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a pointerprior to accessing it. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability tocreate a denial-of-service condition on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
